Prince Henry Alexander Frederick Windsor, Duke of Sussex, was born on February 27, 1985, in London, England. He is the youngest son of Charles, Prince of Wales, and the late Diana, Princess of Wales. Prince Harry, as he is affectionately known, is sixth in line to the British throne.

Prince Harry was educated at Eton College and later attended the Royal Military Academy Sandhurst, where he trained as an army officer. He served two tours of duty in Afghanistan with the British Army, including a stint as a helicopter pilot. After leaving the military, Prince Harry pursued a career in conservation and philanthropy, working with various organizations to protect endangered species and support vulnerable communities.

In 2018, Prince Harry married Meghan Markle, an American actress and philanthropist, at St George's Chapel, Windsor Castle. The couple has two children, Archie Mountbatten-Windsor (born 2019) and Lilibet Mountbatten-Windsor (born 2021). Prince Harry is a devoted father and husband, and his family often accompanies him on official engagements and charitable work.

As the Duke of Sussex, Prince Harry has used his platform to raise awareness and funds for various causes, including mental health, conservation, and supporting military veterans. He is also known for his sense of humor, love of sports, and passion for wildlife conservation.

Despite being a member of the royal family, Prince Harry is often described as down-to-earth and relatable, with a strong connection to the common people. His popularity has only grown in recent years, and he remains one of the most beloved members of the British royal family.
subject: Prince Harry, Duke of Sussex
intro: Prince Harry, Duke of Sussex, is a prominent member of the British royal family.
